abstracts

Class QGameSimple

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstracts.QGame
      • abstracts.QGameSimple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class QGameSimple
extends QGame
    Simplified abstract class. Just add levels and it will handle them properly without your supervision.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QGameSimple()
      Starts the class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLevel(Level level)
      Adds a level to the current game.
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      All the keyboard presses will be registered here, and passed onto currently active level.
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      All the keyboard releases will be registered here, and passed onto currently active level.
      void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      If mouse has entered into the window.
      void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Mouse movement actions will go here.
      void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      If user presses the mouse button.
      protected void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Calls render for the currently loaded and active level.
      protected void setup()
      All it does is call setup() for all levels and then sets level 1 to active.
      protected void update(int deltaTime)
      Calls update function for currently active and loaded level.

        public QGameSimple()

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        protected void setup()
        All it does is call setup() for all levels and then sets level 1 to active.
        Specified by:
        setup in class QGame

      • render

        protected void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Calls render for the currently loaded and active level.
        Specified by:
        render in class QGame
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to which to draw images to.

      • update

        protected void update(int deltaTime)
        Calls update function for currently active and loaded level. As soon as level becomes unactive it will be deleted from this game object and the next level will become active, and then will become loaded.
        Specified by:
        update in class QGame
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - how much time has passed since last time update was called.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard presses will be registered here, and passed onto currently active level.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in class QGame
        Parameters:
        e - What key the user has pressed.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard releases will be registered here, and passed onto currently active level.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in class QGame
        Parameters:
        e - Which key the user has released.

      • mouseEntered

        public void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If mouse has entered into the window. Quite useless but I am giving this lesson nonetheless. All mouse actions are passed to the currently active level only.
        Specified by:
        mouseEntered in class QGame
        Parameters:
        e - Event which shows where the mouse has entered.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If user presses the mouse button. All mouse presses are passed to the currently active level only.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in class QGame
        Parameters:
        e - All the info about which mouse button was pressed and where.

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Mouse movement actions will go here. All mouse motions are passed to the currently active level only.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in class QGame
        Parameters:
        e - Where the mouse is currently located.

      • addLevel

        public void addLevel(Level level)
        Adds a level to the current game. All levels are stored into linked list. They will be called into order of how they are added.
        Parameters:
        level - The level you would like to add.
